short_description: Explore the ancient land of Armenia, the first Christian nation, nestled in the Caucasus mountains. Discover ancient monasteries, stunning mountain landscapes, rich cultural heritage, delicious cuisine, and the warm hospitality of the Armenian people.

health.tap_water_safety: Generally safe in major cities, bottled water recommended in some areas
alcohol_info: It is prohibited to sell, serve, or offer alcohol beverages to anyone under the age of 18
Alcohol can be purchased from licensed venues, supermarkets, and shops
Armenia has a rich wine-making tradition dating back thousands of years

tipping.hotels: Small tips for porters and housekeeping are appreciated
tipping.guides: 10% tip is appreciated for tour guides
tipping.restaurants: 10% tip is customary for good service, though not always expected
tipping.taxis: Rounding up the fare is common

weather.title: Armenia has a highland continental climate with hot summers and cold winters. The weather varies significantly with altitude, with mountainous regions experiencing more extreme conditions.

when_to_visit.title: Summer
when_to_visit.short_description: Warm to hot temperatures perfect for exploring cities, visiting ancient monasteries, and enjoying outdoor activities. Ideal time for hiking in the mountains and visiting Lake Sevan

when_to_visit.title: Spring & Autumn
when_to_visit.time_period: April to May, September to October
when_to_visit.short_description: Mild and pleasant temperatures with beautiful seasonal colors. Perfect for sightseeing, exploring historic sites, wine tours, and hiking. Great time to visit monasteries and cultural attractions

when_to_visit.title: Winter
when_to_visit.short_description: Cold temperatures, especially in mountainous areas. Great for winter sports in Tsaghkadzor and exploring cities without the summer crowds. Yerevan remains relatively mild

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Armenia is during the spring (April to May) and autumn (September to October) months when the weather is mild and pleasant, making it ideal for exploring ancient monasteries, hiking in the mountains, and enjoying the cultural attractions
